info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 1:30PM EDT until April 8 at 8:51PM EDT by NWS Cleveland OH
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio...
Scioto River Near Prospect affecting Marion and Delaware Counties.
Maumee River At Waterville affecting Wood and Lucas Counties.
Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station affecting Trumbull County.
Black River At Elyria affecting Lorain County.
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio...
Killbuck Creek Near Killbuck affecting Wayne and Holmes Counties.
Eagle Creek Above Findlay affecting Hancock County.
For the Black River...including Elyria...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Scioto River...including Prospect...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Killbuck Creek...including Killbuck...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Eagle Creek (Hancock)...including Findlay...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Eagle Creek (Trumbull)...including Phalanx Station...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Scioto River near Prospect.
* WHEN...Until Tuesday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Long stretches of both River Road and Route 257 are flooded in northwest Deleware county, from near Route 36 to the Marion County line.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 13.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 13.9 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall tomorrow evening. It will rise to 13.9 feet Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.9 feet on 03/29/1916.
- Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information.
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/cle.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 1130 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY EVENING
